5.question: Brad Johnson is starting an upscale men's clothing store in a mall near Seattle. He wants to open his store during the time period in which a business like his can realistically enter the new market. Brad is trying to open his business while the ________ is open.

7.question: Which of the following is correct regarding  opportunities and ideas?

options.A: An opportunity and an idea are essentially the same thing.
options.B: An idea almost always meets the criteria of an opportunity.
options.C: An opportunity is a thought, an impression, or a notion.
options.E: It's important to discern whether a particular idea meets the criteria for an opportunity.
options.D: An idea is a favorable set of circumstances that creates a need for a new product, service, or business.

An idea is a favorable set of circumstances that creates a need for a new product, service, or 
business.

11.question: An opportunity has four essential qualities. It is (1) rare, (2) attractive, (3) timely, and (4) anchored in a product, service, or business that creates or adds value for its buyer or end user.

12.question: The term "window of opportunity" is a metaphor describing the time period in which a firm can realistically raise money.

13.question:
An idea is a thought, impression, or notion. It may or may not meet the criteria of an 
opportunity.

14.question: Describe the difference between an idea and an opportunity. Why is the distinction important?

15.question:

16.question: GasBuddy is a company started to help consumers save money on gas. Which environmental trend is most likely to have provided the impetus for the creation of this company?

17.question: Economic forces impact the opportunities available to entrepreneurs. Which of the following alternatives reflects a set of econom ic forces that would be of interest to entrepreneurs?

options.A: Level of disposable income, new uses of old technologies, and new laws and regulations
options.B: New technologies, consumer spending patterns, and new laws
options.C: Housing starts, consumer spending patterns, and stability of interest rates
options.D: Social and cultural trends, level of interest rates, and what people think is "in"
options.E: New changes in political areas, new laws, and level of disposable income

18.question: Which of the following is NOT  an example of a social force?

options.E: Continual migration of people from small towns and rural areas to cities

19.question:
An increased focus on health and wellness has resulted in a number of new business ideas including healthier foods and beverages, yoga instruction and training centers, and nutrition consult ing. An increased focus on health and wellness is an important ________ that is creating 
opportunities in many areas for entrepreneurial firms.

20.question:
The increasing number of social networks on the Internet is attributed to a jump in the numbe r of people who are wanting to connect with one another online. The increasing number of 
social networks is an important ________ trend.

21.question:
Hulu.com allows people to watch television shows and movies on the Internet. Hulu.com's 
business opportunity was made possible by ________ that enhanced the ability of television shows and movies to be uploaded to the Internet and played by anyone with a suitable computer and an Internet connection.

22.question:
If a new firm was launched to help businesses comply with The A ffordable Care Act, that 
opportunity was created by ________.

reputation, privacy, and s afety. Which of the following approaches to identifying an opportunity 
was most likely the impetus for SafetyWeb?

The Savvy Entrepreneurial Firm feature in Chapter 2 features three firms: Swipe Out 
Hunger, Soko, and Drive for Change. All three are examples of ________.

25.question:
Casey Griggs is a very capable computer engineer. Recently, he noticed a problem that computer engineers have, and thought of a solution to the problem tha t might represent an 
opportunity for a new software product. Casey's idea for a new software product is an example of a(n) ________ discovery.

26.question:
Clothing boutiques and specialty shops often start because there is a need for a particular product, but large retaile rs like Wal -Mart and Costco can't sell enough of the item to stock it on 
their shelves. If a clothing boutique started to sell designer clothes or clothing for hard -to-fit 
people because the clothing wasn't being offered by a larger retailer, the best way to describe how that idea was recognized is ________.

options.A: finding a gap in the marketplace

27.question:
Tish Cirovolo realized that there were no guitars on the market made specifically for women. 
As a result, she started Daisy Rock Guitars, a company that makes  guitars just for women. Daisy 
Rock Guitars are stylish and come in feminine colors, and incorporate design features that accommodate a woman's smaller hand and build. The best way to describe how Cirovolo's business idea was recognized is ________.

options.E: finding a gap in the marketplace

recognize that other people feel the same way

31.question: Many new businesses are successful by taking advantage of fads.

33.question: Describe the three separate ways that entrepreneurs identify new business, product, and service opportunities.

34.question:
The What Wrong feature in Chapter 2 focuses on Everpix, a company that enabled users to 
organize and store photos online in an innovative manner. Regrettably, Everpix failed. Accord ing to the feature, Everpix's failure resulted from that fact that it's founders spent too 
much time ________.

options.A: and energy perfecting their service at the expense of building a business
options.B: and energy raising money at the expense of perfecting their servi ce
options.C: networking at the expense of building a business
options.D: marketing their product at the expense of perfecting their service
options.E: analyzing their market at the expense of networking

opportunities that others miss.

36.question: The ability to notice things without engaging in deliberate search is referred to as ________.

37.question:
Kelly Pryor, who has launched several successful entrepreneurial firms, seems to have a 
"sixth sense" that allows him to see opportunities that others miss. Kelly's ability is referred to as _________.

38.question: Which of the following statements is incorrect in regard to entrepreneurial alertness?

options.A: The research findings on entrepreneurial alertness are conclusive.
options.B: Alertness is largely a learned skill.
options.C: People who have more knowledge of an area tend to be more alert to opportunities in that area than others.
options.D: The term "entrepreneurial alertness" is often associated with a "sixth sense" that seems to allow some people to see opportunities that others miss.
options.E: Entrepreneurial alertness is defined as the ability to notice things without engaging in deliberate search.

39.question: According to the textbook, research results over time consistently suggest that somewhere between ________ percent of those who start businesses got their ideas through social contacts.

40.question:
An individual who identifies a business idea on his or her own is referred to as a(n) 
________ entrepreneur.

41.question: A network entrepreneur is an individual who identifies his or her business idea ________.

options.B: through the assistance of a paid consultant

42.question: A solo entrepreneur is an individual who identified his or her business idea ________. A network entrepreneur is an individual who identified his or her business idea ________.

options.B: through a business incubator program; through social contacts
options.A: through social contacts; on their own
options.C: on their own; through social contacts
options.D: through the assistance of a paid consultant; through social contacts
options.E: with one or more pa rtners; on their own

________ rela tionships are characterized by frequent interactions that form between 
coworkers, friends, and spouses.

Most of Sarah's ideas come from interacting with coworkers, friends, her spouse, her parents, and other people that s hare the same beliefs that she does. Sarah is getting most of her ideas 
through ________ - tie relationships.

45.question: Alex has a number of casual acquaintances that he interacts with infrequently. The relationships that Alex has with these peo ple are referred to as ________ -tie relationships.

business idea through a ________ - tie relationship than the alternatives.

49.question:

spends several days "mulling over" the idea, which is her way of thinking it through, at both the 
conscious and unconscious level. The stage of the creative process that Macy is in while she is mulling over an idea  is referred to as ________.

50.question:
In the five -stage creative process, the flash of recognition, or what is sometimes referred to 
as the "eureka" experience, occurs in the ________ stage.

51.question:

referred to as the ________ stage.

Several studies have shown that prior experience in an industry helps entrepreneurs 
recogn ize business opportunities.

Weak -tie relationships are characterized by infrequent interaction and ties between casual

55.question:

weak -tie relationship.

57.question:
Incubation is the stage of the creative process during which an idea is subjected to scrutiny 
and analyzed for its viability.

58.question: Evaluation is the stage of the creative process during which the idea is put into its final form.

options.E: The session is used for decision making.

options.D: no more than 10 people are allowed to participate
options.E: no wild or unrealistic ideas are allowed

63.question:
According to the textbook, a focus group is a gathering of 5 to 10 people who are selected 
because ________.

options.A: they are most likely to purchase large amounts of the product or service being discussed
options.B: they responded to a self -selected opinion poll about the topic being discussed
options.D: they responded to a mail survey about the topic being discussed
options.C: of their relationship to the issue being discussed
options.E: they are spokespersons for the topic being discussed

options.C: focus your efforts on browsing through industry -related materials
options.D: discuss your general area of interest with other library patrons
options.E: focus your efforts on academic journals

65.question: An example of a valuable library resource is IBISWorld, which is a(n) ________.

67.question: Day -in-the-life research is a type of ________ research.
